content.question: A force <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>F</mi></math> is exerted on an object which is initially at rest. The force varies with position <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> and can be described by the equation <math alttext="vector F equals, open parenthesis, A x minus B, close parenthesis, i hat" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mover accent="true"><mi>F</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>B</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mover accent="true"><mi>i</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>B</mi></math> are constants with appropriate units. After moving a distance <math alttext="D sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, the block again comes to rest. An identical object, also initially at rest, experiences a force <math alttext="2 F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>F</mi></math>. The second object comes to rest again after moving a distance <math alttext="D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the relationship between <math alttext="D sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="D sub 0 equals the fraction D sub 1 over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="D sub 0 equals D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="D sub 0 equals 2 D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="D sub 0 equals 4 D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="D sub 0 equals D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
